item.title: Editing Large Files on Windows Platform: EmEditor (Text Editor)
item.description:
The Shanghai Guoan database incident has been buzzing around in the black market circles, and it’s unclear whether itâ€™s true or not. Let’s see if we remember it in two years and take another look. Based on past experience, a wave of local social engineering database information was updated, and I saw a huge SQL file: 17.9G. A regular text editor would have trouble even previewing it, let alone opening it. While chatting with netizens, someone mentioned: EmEditor.

Main body

Website: [https://www.emeditor.com/]

I tried it out during my free time on the weekend, and it’s quite convenient. The design supports editing large files, and with sufficient memory, the entire file is loaded into memory, making searching and editing fast. It also supports splitting files.
